text: What is the recommended way to create a plot with two y axes (i.e. separate y axes on the left and right sides of the plot)? I have multiple data series in a line plot. Some series should be attached to one axis, some to the other axis.

I had the same question some time ago. I got it working as shown here <https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Makie.jl/issues/816|https://github.com/JuliaPlots/Makie.jl/issues/816>

```using CairoMakie
using AbstractPlotting
using DataFrames

fig = Figure(resolution = (500, 350))

ax1 = fig[1,1] = Axis(fig, xlabel = "x axis", ylabel = "first y axis")
ax2 = fig[1,1] = Axis(fig, xlabel = "x axis", ylabel = "second y axis")

A = DataFrame(x=1:5, y=rand(5).*10)
B = DataFrame(x=1:5, y=rand(5))

plot1 = lines!(ax1, A.x, A.y)
plot2 = lines!(ax2, B.x, B.y, color = :blue)

ax2.yaxisposition = :right
ax2.yticklabelalign = (:left, :center)
ax2.xticklabelsvisible = false
ax2.xticklabelsvisible = false
ax2.xlabelvisible = false

linkxaxes!(ax1,ax2)```
